description.overview: Bureaucrats are the puppet masters of the corporate and political arenas, using their charm and commanding presence to influence, control, and manipulate friends and foes alike. They are skilled at negotiation, control, and leveraging situations to their advantage with a mix of charisma and calculated strategy.

system.flashback_trigger: When a prior diplomatic move or policy could influence the present.
system.flashback_effect: Roll to show that you had already maneuvered a policy or agreement that aids the current situation.
system.signature_resource_desc:
As skirmishes rage and battles unfold, each calculated action by allies and each misstep by foes is meticulously observed and analyzed by the Bureaucrat through an advanced neural-link to their nano-augmented interface. This system, woven into the very fabric of their DNA, converts these battlefield events into strands of Red Tape, a nanotechnological representation of growing tactical influence and control.
However, this intricate network of nanite-stratagems is as delicate as it is powerful. Should the Bureaucrat take a hit, the shock disrupts the nanocloud, causing the accumulated Red Tape to dissipate in a burst of lost potential.
system.signature_resource_effect:
You have a d6 Power Die called Red Tape. Whenever an ally Focuses or uses Edge, and whenever an enemy receives a debuff, tick the die up by 1 to a maximum of 6.
At the start of a round, after initiative has been decided, you can choose to Cut Red Tape, activating one of the following effects.
  • 2 Points: Receive 1 Edge for each ally
  • 3 Points: Each Enemy receives -1 Hit on their next Test
  • 4 Points: Each Ally Gains a free Simple Action
  • 5 Points: Each Enemy is Stunned for the round.
  • 6 Points: Each Ally gains +10 to their initiative.

Risk: If the Bureaucrat takes damage, reset their Red Tape Die back to 1.

advancements.effect: +1 to Chosen Attribute up to Breed maximum

advancements.effect: +1 ER when targeted by Ranged Attacks

advancements.effect: +1 ER when targeted by an area of effect attack or explosion

advancements.name: Nano Resist
advancements.effect: +1 ER when targeted by a hostile nano program

advancements.name: Implant Treatment Conditioning
advancements.effect: +1 for Implant Surgery Tests and using Cybernetic Equipment

skill_list.name: Networker
skill_list.description:
• Using your reputation to get people to influence others.
  • Leveraging connections to gain information, resources, or favors.
  • Utilizing social networks for gathering intelligence or support.
  • Creating a web of contacts that can be called upon when needed.

skill_list.name: Secretary
skill_list.description:
• Expertise in legal systems, protocols, and loopholes.
  • Navigating bureaucratic red tape to expedite processes or gain permits.
  • Uncovering crucial details buried in plain sight.
  • Representing or defending in disputes.

skill_list.name: Liaison
skill_list.description:
• Utilizing diplomatic skills to smooth over tensions and build cooperative relationships.
  • Managing relationships and negotiations between factions, organizations, or key individuals.
  • Negotiating or resolving conflicts arising from misunderstandings.
  • Representing one's own group or interests in a culturally sensitive manner.

skill_list.name: Lobbyist
skill_list.description:
• Skilled in influencing public opinion and disseminating information.
  • Crafting persuasive narratives to shape public perception.
  • Countering misinformation or enemy propaganda.
  • Utilizing media and communication channels for strategic messaging.

skill_list.name: Crisis Manager
skill_list.description:
• Handling emergencies or unexpected situations with composure and efficiency.
  • Developing contingency plans for various crisis scenarios.
  • Leading effectively during natural disasters, political upheavals, or major incidents.
  • Coordinating resources and personnel to mitigate crisis impacts.

nanoprograms.name: Defamation 101
nanoprograms.effect: Make Target + Hits less inclined to attack you provided there is another valid target within their range.

signature_traits.name: Administrative Assistant
signature_traits.description:
To ensure their safety and maintain their influence, Bureaucrats are often assigned bodyguards. These bodyguards are not just for protection; they are a status symbol, representing the Bureaucrat's importance and the value their organization places on them. Additionally, bodyguards serve as a deterrent against potential threats, indicating that any aggression towards the Bureaucrat will be met with formidable resistance.

The bodyguard summoning process is a service provided by a specialized division within the Bureaucrat's corporation. When a Bureaucrat activates the summoning nanoprogram, it sends an encrypted signal to this division's command center. The signal includes the Bureaucrat's location, current threat level, and any specific requirements for the situation.

The division then deploys a bodyguard, either a clone of a known mercenary or a robotic agent, equipped with the latest corporate-funded technology. This rapid deployment is often facilitated by the corporation's exclusive grid transport channels, ensuring that their valuable Bureaucrats are never without protection in critical moments.

Your bodyguard has the following statistics
HP: 10+10 for each success
Damage: 5+ x Bureaucracy ranks
Your bodyguard has the following actions. Commanding a bodyguard is a minor action.

  • Interception: The bodyguard can intercept attacks aimed at the Bureaucrat, taking damage in their stead.
  • Intimidation: Use their presence to intimidate enemies, potentially causing them to hesitate or flee.
  • Tactical Positioning: Can position itself to provide tactical advantages, such as blocking enemy movement
  • Surveillance: Gather information or keep watch, alerting the Bureaucrat to hidden dangers or opportunities.
  • Crowd Control: You can spend 10 NP to use non-lethal force to manage groups. If the Test succeeds, all targets are rooted for the round.
  • Negotiation Aid: Assist in negotiations by providing a sense of security, or subtly influence discussions through their presence.
  • Emergency Extraction: Can quickly remove the Bureaucrat from dangerous situations, acting as a personal escape mechanism.

signature_traits.name: Bureaucratically Requisitioned Coffee
signature_traits.description:
In the world of Edge of Anarchy, coffee has evolved beyond a simple beverage and money sink of enthusiasts. It's a culturally significant item, often used in diplomatic and corporate settings as a gesture of goodwill or a symbol of sophisticated negotiation. This enhancing coffee is specially nano formulated to boost cognitive functions and stamina.

The brew you requisition is dependent on how much money is spent. You can add 1 effect per 200 credits spent.

  • Enhanced Focus: For the next 2 hours, players receive a +1 bonus to all skill Tests involving concentration or detail-oriented tasks.
  • Elevated Mood: Morale is boosted, granting a +1 to all Social tests for the next 2 hours.
  • Increased Alertness: Players gain a temporary boost in initiative, the first encounter is treated as if your party has surprised the enemy.
  • Stamina Surge: Temporary +2 bonus to endurance or stamina-related checks, useful in prolonged tasks or encounters.
  • Social Bonding: Drinking coffee together improves team dynamics, you can choose to reroll a single Glitch dice, potentially saving all stored Edge.

signature_traits.name: Insurance Claim
signature_traits.description:
Combined with their deep understanding of Rubi-Ka’s political and economic landscapes with their ability to utilize the forefront of nanotech, Bureaucrats can craft insurance policies that are more than mere contractual agreements; they're backed by nano-agents that actively monitor and respond to insured scenarios. During downtime, you can enact one of the following insurance policies.

  • Equipment Insurance:
    • Pay upfront cost.
    • Effect: In case of equipment damage/loss, receive replacements or repair funds.
  • Mission Failure Insurance:
    • Purchase before accepting a mission.
    • Effect: If mission fails, receive partial rewards or reputation protection.
  • Travel Insurance:
    • Buy before a journey.
    • Effect: If an incident occurs during travel, gain immediate assistance or resources.
  • Health Insurance:
    • Regular premium payments.
    • Effect: Access to enhanced healing services or reduced cost for medical care post-combat.
  • Investment Insurance:Secure a financial investment.
  • Effect: Compensation or partial recovery of funds if the investment fails.
